content.rendered:
Philip Huff

Director of Cybersecurity Research | Assistant Professor, Department of Computer Science

Dr. Huff is an Assistant Professor of Computer Science at the University of Arkansas in Little Rock and the Director of Cybersecurity Research in the Emerging Analytics Center. He has a 15-year history of working in the electric power-delivery industry managing cybersecurity operations and has co-founded the cybersecurity AI startup Bastazo, Inc. He has a Ph.D. in Computer Science (2021) from the University of Arkansas and an M.S. in Computer Science with Infosec specialization (2008) from James Madison University.  He is a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP).
